pr_title: [WFLY-12985] Provide a separate feature pack and dist for non-observability MP specs

timeline.message:
[WFLY-12985] Move jwt from the ee feature pack and dists to the full one

As with FaultTolerance and OpenAPI this means removal of the feature from the legacy non-Galleon feature pack.

Unlike FaultTolerance and OpenAPI, JWT is meant to be part of our standard configs, so this requires overrides of the various Galleon configs for the standalone model, plus the high level feature-groups used for those models and for domain.xml

[WFLY-12985] Allow test jobs to control which feature pack is used to provision 'ee' servers

Both the top level 'wildfly' feature pack and its dependency the 'wildfly-ee' feature pack should work. Default to testing using 'wildfly' but let test jobs override this to test the other option.

timeline.bodyText:
Should not this change be also effective for the legacy product module.xml?
https://github.com/wildfly/wildfly/blob/master/dist-legacy/src/distribution/resources/modules/system/layers/base/org/jboss/as/product/wildfly-full/module.xml#L25
We could add and additional verification to ensure modules/system/layers/base/org/jboss/as/product/wildfly-ee/module.xml has the correct one

timeline.message: [WFLY-12985] Allow test jobs to control which maven project is the source of the build under test

[WFLY-12985] Support using -Ddisable.microprofile.tests to turn off surefire executions that must run against a dist with the full set of MP functionality.

If a test job is configured using jboss.dist to point at an external distribution and that distribution doesn't have the full set of MP features, use this ability to turn off parts of the testsuite that are expected to fail.

[WFLY-12985] Separate the layers in the wildfly-ee feature pack in the Galleon layers doc page

Also, WFLY-13027 -- add a doc line for microprofile-openapi

timeline.bodyText:
If these artifacts are removed from feature-pack, they're not runtime artifacts anymore.
Moving them to galleon-pack means that they're build dependencies, not runtime.
Is it correct from the perspective of using WildFly Server?
cc @rgdoliveira
timeline.author: dosoudil

replies.bodyText:
They are still runtime dependencies of any server that uses the 'wildfly' galleon pack. The output of this maven module and the 'servlet-feature-pack' maven module are 'legacy feature packs' and are not used in any WildFly distribution. We just maintain these modules so projects that still want to create custom WF-technology-based servers using the legacy feature packs can use their output. But an official WildFly dist does not use the output of these. (You could do 'mvn install -pl dist -am' and this maven module wouldn't even build.)
However, our official dists do use some source from these maven modules. This is so we can build the official Galleon feature packs and these legacy ones and not have to duplicate the source, which would almost certainly lead to bugs.  The Galleon feature pack poms actually copy over the source resources they need:
https://github.com/wildfly/wildfly/blob/master/galleon-pack/pom.xml#L73
https://github.com/wildfly/wildfly/blob/master/servlet-galleon-pack/pom.xml#L548
replies.author: bstansberry

timeline.message:
[WFLY-12985] Separate the layers in the wildfly-ee feature pack in the Galleon layers doc page

Also, WFLY-13027 -- add a doc line for microprofile-openapi

[WFLY-12985] Separate the layers in the wildfly-ee feature pack in the Galleon layers doc page

Also, WFLY-13027 -- add a doc line for microprofile-openapi

[WFLY-12985] Rename galleon-pack, build and dist maven modules by prefixing with 'ee-'

This is a foundational step, putting in place a structure for producing our traditional top-level feature pack and dists.

[WFLY-12985] Create new galleon-pack, build and dist maven modules to hold MP content

Create the new feature pack and dists. These use the traditional maven module names and GAVs as our standard dist will include the rapidly evolving MP items. New artifact ids are given to the non-MP feature pack and dist artifacts.
[WFLY-12985] Use a distinct product module for the ee dist vs the complete one

[WFLY-12985] Facilitate separate maven versions for ee dist vs complete dist

This may be useful for EAP.

[WFLY-12985] Move fault-tolerance from the ee feature pack and dists to the full one

This removes fault-tolerance from the 'legacy' non-Galleon feature packs. Legacy f-ps are only maintained to help Keycloak (which doesn't need MP) until it can move to Galleon.

This requires overrides of the Galleon domain config and the high level feature groups used in it in order to integrate the MP variant of domain-host-excludes.

[WFLY-12985] Move openapi from the ee feature pack and dists to the full one

As with Fault Tolerance this means removal of this feature from the legacy non-Galleon feature pack.

[WFLY-12985] Move jwt from the ee feature pack and dists to the full one

As with FaultTolerance and OpenAPI this means removal of the feature from the legacy non-Galleon feature pack.

Unlike FaultTolerance and OpenAPI, JWT is meant to be part of our standard configs, so this requires overrides of the various Galleon configs for the standalone model, plus the high level feature-groups used for those models and for domain.xml

[WFLY-12985] Allow test jobs to control which feature pack is used to provision 'ee' servers

Both the top level 'wildfly' feature pack and its dependency the 'wildfly-ee' feature pack should work. Default to testing using 'wildfly' but let test jobs override this to test the other option.
[WFLY-12985] Allow test jobs to control which maven project is the source of the build under test

[WFLY-12985] Support using -Ddisable.microprofile.tests to turn off surefire executions that must run against a dist with the full set of MP functionality.

If a test job is configured using jboss.dist to point at an external distribution and that distribution doesn't have the full set of MP features, use this ability to turn off parts of the testsuite that are expected to fail.

[WFLY-12985] Separate the layers in the wildfly-ee feature pack in the Galleon layers doc page

Also, WFLY-13027 -- add a doc line for microprofile-openapi
